channel.title: Personal on Gonzalo's thoughts
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on Gonzalo's thoughts

item.title: I'm no longer a Monzo client
item.description: A happy user I joined Monzo in 2016. Ex-Monzo user 4956. I even interviewed with Tom Blomfield, former CEO of Monzo in 2014 when he was still with Anne Boden, former CEO of Starling.

item.title: Daily lessons from London trains
item.description: For many people not living in the UK, it will come as a surprise that the railway system in London is quite expensive and provides a really bad service. Train service is not a theme park.

item.title: King George III and the “rebellion”
item.description: I enjoy buying books. I read physical books too. I enjoy starting them. Honestly, finishing books is more difficult for me. But I’ve been trying to improve on that. I was very excited when I bought ‘1776’ by David McCullough.

item.title: Launching a business: why?
item.description: I’ll start sharing a secret. I want to launch a business.Yes, I know many people in the tech industry are in the same situation. They’ve got some burning idea to launch or some dream to fulfil.

item.title: Jack Ma and laughing at ourselves
item.description: If you don’t know who is Jack Ma, he’s the founder and CEO of Alibaba, the marketplace and reportedly the richest person in Asia. I must confess he’s always amazing me.

item.title: Chess, trading and Bregret
item.description: When I was child, I used to play chess. From time to time you would find somebody that just had learned a special kind of opening and had decided to practice no matter what.

item.title: Storytelling
item.description: A few days ago I was listening a podcast about the importance of being able to tell a story, not a lists of jobs when asked about you. In a spirit of practising, I’m going to share two stories of my early life that affects who I am.

item.title: Gifts
item.description: Black Friday is next Friday, so that means Christmas is coming. All around will push us to buy things: food, clothing, gifts. A couple of weeks ago we started receiving some catalogs from several different NGOs.

item.title: Think big
item.description: A few weeks ago, I’m not sure why, one of my daughters proposed to create a system to find cars inside garages at the shopping center. The car would locate itself using a GPS and then it would emit via radio.

item.title: What recruiters taught me about looking for a job
item.description: There are good recruiters. And there are bad recruiters. The good ones help you to find a job. The bad ones teach you how to look for a job. If you are looking for a job, be sure to do just the opposite of what the bad ones do.

item.title: Future
item.description: More than six years ago I started this blog. I wanted to practice my English so that I would improve it. Four years later I came to London and sort of abandoned it, thinking that working in an English speaking environment would be enough to practice.

item.title: Happy Christmas
item.description: Happy Christmas and a wonderful 2015 to all of my readers.

item.title: Good examples
item.description: I was made redundant at the end of March. It was a very stressful process but it ended up very well, as I’ve been in my new job for almost a month and I’m very happy.

item.title: Tipping point
item.description: I’m happy. I was developing a feature that allows to export from my showcase project Whendoigo to TripIt. I was using a gem from TripIt. A gem is kind of a library for Ruby (sort of jar for Java).

item.title: Community managers: The day after
item.description: Yesterday I followed on Twitter a case where the community manager for a -well known and with very good reputation- Spanish moving company literally screwed up their reputation. He/she threatened to sue a customer that was expressing a complaint on Twitter, because the client had used the hash tag “vergonzoso” (shameful).

item.title: Companies, developers and recruitment
item.description: A few months ago I reported my business unit was offered for sale. Not much to report about it (I know very little and I can write even less) Obviously, most of us in the business unit, decided to brush up our Linkedin pages and get into the job market, just in case.

item.title: Driving in the UK
item.description: Today I rented a car for a few hours. I used to drive in Spain, but I hadn’t driven since I came to London. I wanted to practice in not too stressful conditions before my family comes to visit me.

item.title: Relocating to London
item.description: In two weeks I will be working in London. I know I was expecting to continue my last post about Spring persistence. I have lots of things to write about the incredible experience of finding a job abroad and relocating.

item.title: Techzing wives
item.description: I tend to listen Techzing podcast. It’s a podcast about very different topics, recorded by two geeks, (or developers, and entrepeneurs). I don’t remember when I started listening them. I do remember I started because I wanted to practice English and it was great (Justin is an Englishman and Jason is American).

item.title: Thoughts about a death
item.description: Sometimes you start to write because you need to write but you don’t know what you want to express. This is one of those times. A couple of days ago, a pregnant woman was killed, and another woman was wounded by a man in a church in Madrid and afterwards the man committed suicide.

item.title: Civil service: Why me?
item.description: A few days ago I promised to explain why I chose to become a civil servant, and why I keep being one. I was going to write about the challenge of a competitive examination, how challenges motivates me, and how my job keeps being interesting even though sometimes is a bit tough.

item.title: Spring course
item.description: I’m attending this week to a Spring Framework course. It’s a very small class: the teacher, my boss and me. I don’t consider myself slow, and neither is my boss. No, he doesn’t read this blog.

item.title: Copyright protection
item.description: You know something is broken with copyright when: You buy a “Barbie and three Musqueteers” DVD and you can’t play in your DVD player because it’s piracy protected. But… You download the same film from a P2P network, save to a CD and you can play it everywhere.

item.title: Lots of old friends
item.description: Yes. I know I was supposed to write about Civil service in Spain. But I’ve promised myself to write a blog post Monday through Thursday. Nobody reads this, my head is full of memories, and I’m not able to write about the planned topic.

item.title: Scrum for myself
item.description: Yesterday I explained I have attended recently a couple of courses. One of them was about Scrum. The course was very interesting, although, as I explained in the evaluation, there were times when I wished there were only one teacher instead of three.

item.title: The passionate programmer
item.description: The last few weeks have been really intense with respect to my career. I’ve attended two courses, given some presentations, launched a few projects at work, and read some books. Sometimes I’ve been under a lot of self-imposed pressure, but overall I’ve learned a lot of things.

item.title: Starting over
item.description: 6 months since last post. These have been amazing ones. Lots of work to do. Lots of challenges. We left Mantis, now working with Redmine. Learning Ruby on Rails. And learning Grails for fun and for the job.

item.title: Some thoughts about Tecnimap 2010
item.description: I’ve been a couple of days in Zaragoza (Spain), participating in Tecnimap 2010 last week. Tecnimap is a conference on IT for the Public Administration in Spain. I had presented a paper about one of the applications I manage: DocelWeb.

item.title: New Year's resolutions ... in August
item.description: I’ve been on holidays, and I’ve had some spare time to stop and think. Last couple of months have been special. Some events have affected profoundly. One of those events has been the death of a collegue.

item.title: Three months later
item.description: Yes. It’s been three months since I wrote my previous post. When I started to write this blog I knew it could end like other blogs I have started. But I didn’t think I was going to stop writing so fast.
